title: Soirée, a night of fabulous music

items.title: Coming Back in 2025
items.summary: It may seem as if the 2024 Soirée has just happened, but we are already making plans for the next. One of the first things to do is to secure a date, and now we can mark off that task as completed. Save the date…
items.content_html:
It may seem as if the 2024 Soirée has just happened, but we are already making plans for the next. One of the first things to do is to secure a date, and now we can mark off that task as completed. Save the date for Saturday 23rd August 2025 for more showcasing of live music and art.

Live music has been taking a hit in recent years. Locally we have seen Sunlit Sounds no longer continuing, and Junk Bar is moving out of Ashgrove. We want to keep live music alive in our community, and we need your support for that. Tell your friends and family about the Soirée and bring them along. It is as simple as that.

See you at the Soirée in 2025!

items.title: This Is The Week
items.summary: This is the week when the 2024 Soirée, a night of fabulous music, happens! Join us on Saturday 24th August at The Gap State School MPB. Doors 5pm, show 6:30pm. Get your tickets now or get them at the door. Six great music acts, one…
items.content_html: This is the week when the 2024 Soirée, a night of fabulous music, happens! Join us on Saturday 24th August at The Gap State School MPB. Doors 5pm, show 6:30pm. Get your tickets now or get them at the door. Six great music acts, one beautiful art gallery from The Gap Creative, food, wine and more.

items.title: 2024 Tickets Now Available
items.summary: The time has come, and tickets for the 2024 Soirée, a night of fabulous music, are now available! With new artists performing at the Soirée for the first time and some favourites returning, it is going to be another fantastic night of live music and…
items.content_html:
The time has come, and tickets for the 2024 Soirée, a night of fabulous music, are now available! With new artists performing at the Soirée for the first time and some favourites returning, it is going to be another fantastic night of live music and art at The Gap State School hall on Saturday 24th August.

Headlining this year will be OBISUN, a family trio whose infectious and uplifting vibes will be sure to get you moving. Nicole Murray is a veteran of the Australian folk music scene, and will be performing solo for the first time. Beetle Miyela is a sound and performance artist that will take you places extraordinary and imaginary, and Elijah Jak will be bringing his solo project, simple but emotionally-moving material with just a guitar, some words and a voice.

Returning from previous years are Tessitura Acapella, a crowd favourite with some new music just for us, and Emily Winter on cello, this time performing with her sister Anna in a cello duet as The Winter Sisters.

Also returning will be The Gap Creative with a beautiful art gallery showing a selection of their wonderful artworks from local creators. This was a highlight last year, and it will be fantastic to see (and buy!) their latest works again.

Many thanks to our brilliant supporters and sponsors. Cr Steven Toomey and the Lord Mayor's Community Fund for their very generous support. Jonty Bush, Member for Cooper and Elizabeth Watson-Brown, Member for Ryan have also provided generous support. We would also like to thank our sponsors Olivia Rogers Orthodontics and The Rotary Club of Ashgrove The Gap for their support in bringing this event to life in our beautiful suburb.

Proceeds from the Soirée go to the Music Supporters Group at The Gap State School, a sub-committee of the P&C. This group supports the brilliant instrumental and choral music programs at The Gap State School.

Get a group of family and friends together and come along for a night of fabulous music, and support live music and the arts in our community. Get your tickets now and we'll see you at the Soirée!

items.title: Save the 2024 Date
items.summary: Save the date for the 2024 Soirée! Saturday 24th August will see more fabulous music and art return to The Gap. As usual, all funds raised from the Soirée will support the instrumental and choral music programs at The Gap State School. Show your support…
items.content_html: Save the date for the 2024 Soirée! Saturday 24th August will see more fabulous music and art return to The Gap. As usual, all funds raised from the Soirée will support the instrumental and choral music programs at The Gap State School. Show your support for live music and local artists by organising a group of family and friends to come along and enjoy a fabulous night of entertainment. Artists will be announced later in the year along with the ticket launch, so follow the Facebook or Instagram pages to be notified of the latest updates.

items.title: And that was 2023
items.summary: That is the Soirée done again for another year. This one exceeded every expectation I had (except for perhaps audience numbers, but we'll work on that with your help). Thank you so much to the artists who performed for us. Monique Clare, Amaidí, Rebecca Wright…
items.content_html:
That is the Soirée done again for another year. This one exceeded every expectation I had (except for perhaps audience numbers, but we'll work on that with your help). Thank you so much to the artists who performed for us. Monique Clare, Amaidí, Rebecca Wright & Donald McKay, Aliya Grace, Robert Bloodwood and The Aristocats. You were all fabulous.
 
Thank you to the volunteers from the Music Supporters Group of The Gap State School P&C who put in the effort to make this event happen. That I could just leave the decorations and the kitchen and other bits and pieces to you and it got done magnificently.
 
The art exhibition from The Gap Creative Inc. was brilliant and beautiful. It was so nice to see so many exquisite artworks from local artists.
 
The catering from Teresa at The Gap State High School was delectable. That there was so little left over at the end is a testament to how much it was loved.
 
The support from Cr Steven Toomey, Jonty Bush - Member for Cooper and RubyRed Jewellery was so very much appreciated. This event could not happen without that support.
 
To Isaac for handling sound. It is so nice to hand that very important job off to someone and have it handled professionally and efficiently.
 
And to the audience who came along to listen, see and experience the talents of our local musicians and artists. Thank you so very much for supporting this event. It only makes me so much more keen to do it better next year.
 
Spread the word, and let's get this event bigger and better in 2024.

items.title: Get Your Tickets Now
items.summary: It is now only one more week until the Soirée for 2023 brings another round of fabulous music. Grab your tickets now for this wonderful event! Look at this wonderful line-up. Music from Aliya Grace, The Aristocats, Rebecca Wright & Donald McKay, Amaidí, Robert Bloodwood,…
items.content_html:
It is now only one more week until the Soirée for 2023 brings another round of fabulous music. Grab your tickets now for this wonderful event! Look at this wonderful line-up.

Music from Aliya Grace, The Aristocats, Rebecca Wright & Donald McKay, Amaidí, Robert Bloodwood, and Monique Clare. Pre-show and interval music provided by the Rock Band and Cello Choir from The Gap State High School. Art exhibition by the creatives at The Gap Creative with the pieces available for purchase.  Beer, wine and food available to keep those cravings satisfied. A raffle with prizes donated by Cr Steven Toomey and Jonty Bush MP. Some artist merchandise available.

Doors open at 5pm. Pre-show entertainment at 5:45pm. Show starts at 6:30pm. Make sure you arrive early enough to take in the art exhibition and pre-show entertainment.

There is something for everyone here, and you may even find something new that you hadn't seen before. So head on over to the Tickets page and we will...

See you at the Soirée!

items.title: Tickets Now Available
items.summary: Many people will be glad to hear this, as I have been asked many times when tickets will be available for the 2023 Soirée. It is a pleasure to announce that tickets are now available for this highly anticipated community live music event! The Soirée…
items.content_html:
Many people will be glad to hear this, as I have been asked many times when tickets will be available for the 2023 Soirée. It is a pleasure to announce that tickets are now available for this highly anticipated community live music event!

The Soirée continues to deliver a diverse range of live music styles and genres. Returning from the 2022 event we have Aliya Grace with some new original songs. New group Amaidí brings traditional Irish tunes with an Australian twist. Rebecca Wright and Donald McKay's music has been likened to that of a good Scotch whisky. The Aristocats bring a modern fusion with slick piano licks, groovy bass lines and tasty drum fills. We will be taken to the imaginary country of Diaspora with folk tunes by Robert Bloodwood. And finally, Monique Clare wields a cello and strikingly crafted vocals.

Our friends at local artisan collective The Gap Creative will be showing artworks by their very talented artists in the art gallery. If you have visited any of their other exhibitions around our community, you will know the very high calibre of our local artists. These artworks will also be available for purchase if you would like to take some home.

Set aside the evening of Saturday 16th September, grab your friends and family, secure some tickets and come along to enjoy some fabulous music, fantastic artwork, wine, food and terrific company.

See you at the Soirée!

items.title: Coming Back in September
items.summary: Save the date for Saturday 16th September when the Soirée is back for another night of fabulous music in The Gap. Another fantastic selection of artists across a range of styles will be guaranteed to please. Tickets go on sale in July.
items.content_html: Save the date for Saturday 16th September when the Soirée is back for another night of fabulous music in The Gap. Another fantastic selection of artists across a range of styles will be guaranteed to please. Tickets go on sale in July.

items.title: Remembering the 2022 Soirée
items.summary: Were you there at the 2022 Soirée to experience a night of fabulous music? Remember some of those wonderful acts or introduce other people to the delights of the Soirée with our photo gallery from the night. The 2023 Soirée is already in the planning…
items.content_html:
Were you there at the 2022 Soirée to experience a night of fabulous music? Remember some of those wonderful acts or introduce other people to the delights of the Soirée with our photo gallery from the night.

The 2023 Soirée is already in the planning stages. Check back here often or like and follow the Facebook page to be notified of announcements.

We'll see you at the next Soirée!

items.title: The Final Group is ... Topology
items.summary: We are very proud to announce that the final group joining the program for the 2022 Soirée are Topology, established leaders in musical creativity in Australia, prolific creators of new original work, expert collaborators across genres and art forms and award-winning music educators. Topology are…
items.content_html:
We are very proud to announce that the final group joining the program for the 2022 Soirée are Topology, established leaders in musical creativity in Australia, prolific creators of new original work, expert collaborators across genres and art forms and award-winning music educators.

Topology are famous for the breadth and depth of their collaborations. Undaunted by stylistic barriers, the quintet has created stunning new work with partners in theatre (Geoffrey Rush, Neil Armfield, Queensland Theatre Company), classical music (the Brodsky Quartet, the Southern Cross Soloists), contemporary art music (Terry Riley, Speak Percussion), dance (Expressions Dance Company, Heidi Duckler Dance Theatre, Jody Oberfelder), puppetry (Dead Puppet Society), contemporary jazz (Trichotomy, Loops), popular songwriting (Kate Miller-Heidke, Katie Noonan), comedy (the Kransky Sisters, Gerry Connolly), Asian music (Dheeraj Shrestha, Ubiet) and indigenous Australian music (William Barton).

Make sure to grab your tickets now to catch Topology, The Vocalise Duo, Aliya Grace, Bluesuits Quartet, Tessitura Acapella and Viridian Quartet at the Soirée on Saturday 4th June.

See you at the Soirée!
